title: Phishing Analysis Challenge 2
instructions:
You are a SOC Analyst at Global Logistics. Emily Nguyen, a member of the marketing team, recently had trouble signing into her Dropbox account after trying to access it for the first time in months and reached out to her manager for assistance. The next day, she received an email that claims a password change request was made for her Dropbox account. The email includes a link for resetting her password, but Emily is unsure if the request is legitimate. Concerned about potential phishing, she has forwarded the email to the security team for analysis.

Using what you've learned within this domain, perform a detailed email analysis on the challenge2.eml file to answer the report questions below.

Challenge File:

  • 01_Phishing_Analysis/Challenges/challenge2.eml

questions.question: Based on the contents of the email header, what is the full date and time of the email delivery?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the Date header.

questions.question: What is the subject of the email?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the Subject header.

questions.question: Who was the email sent to?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the To header.

questions.question: Based on the sender's display name, who does the email claim to be from?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the From header. Specifically, the display name portion.

questions.question: What is the sender's email address?
questions.hint: Check the contents of the From header. Specifically, the email address portion.

questions.question: What email address is used for receiving bounced emails?
questions.hint: This is also sometimes known as the bounce address or the reverse path.

questions.question: What is the IP address of the sender's email server?
questions.hint: Look for the IP address within the Received headers.

questions.question: What is the resolved hostname of the sender's IP address?
questions.hint: Perform a reverse DNS lookup on the previously identified IP address.

questions.question: What is the Autonomous System Number (ASN) that owns this IP address?
questions.hint: Perform a reverse DNS lookup on the previously identified IP address.

questions.question: What was the result of the SPF check?
What is the full SPF record of the sender's domain?
questions.hint: Run nslookup -type=txt against the domain previously identified in the Return-Path.

questions.question: What type of encoding was used to transfer the email body content?
questions.hint: Look for any email headers related to content encoding.

questions.question: Look in the plaintext version of the email. In defanged format, what is the first URL extracted from the email?
questions.hint: Use CyberChef to defang the URL. Make sure you also decode any content transfer encoding first!

questions.question: Perform a Cisco Talos lookup on the base domain of the URL in the previous question. What is its web reputation?
[Yes or No] - After your analysis, is this email genuine?
